location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The subject 464 (Persia: Bushire hinterland) consists of two volumes, IOR/L/PS/10/650-651. The volumes are divided into three parts, with parts 1 and 3 comprising one volume, and part 2 comprising the second volume.The papers are arranged in chronological order from the rear to the front of the volume.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 194; these numbers are written in pencil and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The volume contains papers relating to military operations in the hinterland of Bushire [Bushehr] in Persia [Iran].The volume consists of two parts: Part 1 [IOR/L/PS/10/650/1], and Part 3 [IOR/L/PS/10/650/2].Each part includes a divider which gives the subject and part numbers, the year the subject file was opened, the subject heading, and a list of correspondence references contained in that part by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.

name.namePart: Government of India, Foreign and Political Department
Viceroy and Governor-General of India in Council
